roleset.name: lacking moisture

roles.note: arg2 added for the adjective, and can potentially occur with the verb as well, although rarely (and I doubt it's come up before, or there would be an arg for it).

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT-4,5, dry-v.02.

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: A 'dry cough' is dry of mucus.

example.name: Adjectival rel: dry; arg1
example.text: I noticed i was getting these permanent forehead lines and that my face was a bit dry .

roleset.name: lacking adornment, emotion, warmth
roleset.note: Added by Julia based on WordNet.

example.name: arg1
example.text: If you remember George Burns and Gracie Allen, George's humor was dry.

example.name: arg1
example.text: The reading was a little dry but filled with authority.

roleset.name: containing low residual sugar (as of wine)

example.name: arg1
example.text: However, depending on the level of acids (and to a lesser extent alcohol and/or tannins), our perception of whether a wine is dry or sweet may differ somewhat from its dry/sweet designation.

example.name: words to live by?
example.text: Make sure her martini is extra dry, and that your apron is tied straight.

example.name: arg1
example.text: he's been dry for ten years.

example.name: arg1
example.text: Get yer liquor before you come, because this county is dry.
